title_sort: william f. bainbridge to walt whitman, 23 august 1865
title: William F. Bainbridge to Walt Whitman, 23 August 1865
text: My Dear & Esteemed Freind[friend]I take the present opporutnity[opportunity] to write you these few lines to inform you that i[I] am well and in good health at Present time and i[I] truly hope when these few lines reach you that they may find you enjoying good health. i[I] answered your last letter and not having recivd[recieved] any answer i[I] think it very Strange i[I] recivd[recieved] these two pictures and give one to wilson[Wilson], and kept one my self and i[I] was very glad to recive[recieve] them for i[I] would rather see your face than your picture at all wilson[Wilson] wrote the same time that i[I] did and not having Recived[received] any answer and wilson[Wilson] says he can not think What the reason is that he does not get and answer from you. Me and wilson[Wilson] expecty[expects] to come through there this fall and we will come and see you if ever you have the opportunity of calling around richmond[Richmond] please to call around Camp Grant and see us. please excuse this Short Letter Write soon good by I remain your Freind[friend] William F. Bainbridge to Walt Whitman, 23 August 1865
